abstract.para: Nutrients from the Kuparuk River during the summer of 1999.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Kuparuk River, North Slope of Alaska

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: October, 1999 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Karie Slavik DATE: October, 1999

para.literalLayout: Water samples collected at designated sites along the Kuparuk river were analyzed at Toolik for soluble reactive phosphate, ammonium, using manual chemistry methods listed in the LTER database protocols. Ammonium was also analyzed using a fluorometric method (Holmes et al. 1999). Nitrate/nitrite were run on a Lachat in Woods Hole.

Notes: There are two ammonium values reported in this data file: one produced using the phenol hypochlorite (detection limit 0.1ÂµM) and another using the Holmes et al. method (detection limit unknown at this time). Detection limits for SRP and Nitrate were 0.05ÂµM and 0.08ÂµM, respectively.

Reference Citations: R.G. Wetzel & G.E. Likens. 1979. Limnological Methods. Saunders. Philadelphia. APHA. 1985. Standard Methods. Boyd. Albany. R.M. Holmes, A. Aminot, r. Kerouel, B.A. Hooker, and B.J. Peterson. 1999. A simple and precise method for measuring ammonium in marine and freshwater ecosystems. Can. J. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 56: 1-8.
